snippet: The territorial leader has backed the company’s lease in Darwin after a research institute said it could be used to spy on American Marines based there.
abstract: Australia defends its decision to lease part of port in Darwin to Chinese company Landbridge Group, despite concerns that firm has links to China's military and could use port to spy on American military based in area.

byline.contributor: Michelle Innis contributed reporting from Sydney, Australia. Kiki Zhao contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: The territorial leader has backed the company’s lease in Darwin after a research institute said it could be used to spy on American Marines based there.

headline.main: Australia Defends Port’s Lease to Chinese Company With Military Ties
headline.print_headline: Australia Defends Lease of Port to Chinese Company

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
